        Mahindra XUV 3XO vs Tata Nexon

        Should you buy Mahindra XUV 3XO or Tata Nexon? Find out which car is best for you - compare the two models on the basis of their Price, Size, Space, Boot Space, Service cost, Mileage, Features, Colours and other specs. Mahindra XUV 3XO price starts at Rs 7.49 Lakh ex-showroom for MX1 (Petrol) and Tata Nexon price starts Rs 7.99 Lakh ex-showroom for Smart Opt (Petrol). XUV 3XO has 1498 cc (Diesel top model) engine, while Nexon has 1497 cc (Diesel top model) engine. As far as mileage is concerned, the XUV 3XO has a mileage of 20.6 kmpl (Diesel top model)> and the Nexon has a mileage of 24.08 kmpl (Diesel top model).

                        Pros & Cons

                        • Pros
                        • Cons

                          Mahindra XUV 3XO

                          • Spacious cabin among the roomiest in class.
                          • Well-specced lower variants such as the MX3 Pro and AX5.
                          • Long feature list including panoramic sunroof, L2 ADAS, 360° camera and twin 10.25” screens.
                          • Option of automatic with both petrol and diesel engine.

                          Tata Nexon

                          • Loaded with features: sunroof, front seat ventilation, dual displays
                          • Comfortable ride quality: tackles bad roads with ease
                          • Choice of petrol and diesel engines. New 7-speed DCT available with petrol
                          • Updated interior features better design and quality

                          Mahindra XUV 3XO

                          • Limited bootspace. No parcel shelf provided.
                          • Minor misses: seat ventilation, wireless Apple CarPlay.

                          Tata Nexon

                          • Ergonomic issues still persist
                          • Iffy fit and finish around certain interior panels
